title: Life After Life
author: Kate Atkinson
description: Ursula Todd is born in 1910 and dies before she takes her first breath—then she's born again, living different versions of her life through the early 20th century and WWII.

title: American Dirt
author: Jeanine Cummins
description: After a Mexican cartel murders her journalist husband and most of her family, Lydia and her son flee Acapulco on La Bestia—the migrant train—heading for the US border.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: Amir, a wealthy boy in 1970s Kabul, betrays his loyal servant and best friend Hassan. Decades later, he returns to Taliban-controlled Afghanistan seeking redemption.

title: What Is the What
author: Dave Eggers
description: The autobiographical novel of Valentino Achak Deng, one of Sudan's Lost Boys who survived civil war, refugee camps, and resettlement in America.

title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: Two Afghan women from different generations become reluctant sister-wives to a brutal husband and form an unlikely bond across three decades of war.

title: And the Mountains Echoed
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: In 1952 Afghanistan, a father sells his daughter to a wealthy couple in Kabul, separating her from her adoring brother. The novel follows the rippling consequences.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death, Nora finds herself in a library where each book lets her live a different version of her life—the lives she might have had.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: Twin sisters from a small Louisiana town run away at 16. One returns to marry the darkest man in town; the other secretly passes as white in Los Angeles.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: In planned-perfect Shaker Heights, a mysterious artist mother and daughter rent from the Richardson family, and both families' secrets ignite.

title: Homegoing
author: Yaa Gyasi
description: Two half-sisters are born in 18th-century Ghana: one marries a British slaver, the other is sold into slavery. Traces their descendants through 300 years.

title: Transcendent Kingdom
author: Yaa Gyasi
description: Gifty, a Ghanaian-American neuroscientist at Stanford, studies addiction while caring for her depressed mother and grappling with her abandoned faith.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Seven generations of the Buendía family rise and fall in the mythical town of Macondo, as history repeats itself in magical and tragic ways.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Florentino Ariza falls passionately in love with Fermina Daza as a teenager. She marries another. He waits over fifty years to declare his love again.

title: Atonement
author: Ian McEwan
description: Thirteen-year-old Briony witnesses an encounter, misinterprets it, and makes an accusation that destroys multiple lives across WWII England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Nick Carraway befriends his mysterious millionaire neighbor Jay Gatsby, who throws lavish parties hoping to reunite with the married woman he's loved since before the war.

title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot Díaz
description: Oscar is an overweight Dominican-American nerd who dreams of becoming the next Tolkien. His family's curse traces back to the Trujillo dictatorship.

title: A Fine Balance
author: Rohinton Mistry
description: During India's 1975 State of Emergency, four strangers share a small apartment. Their intertwined fates expose systemic brutality.

title: Interior Chinatown
author: Charles Yu
description: Willis Wu is a Background Oriental Male on a cop show, dreaming of promotion. Written as a screenplay, skewering Hollywood's treatment of Asian Americans.

title: Great Circle
author: Maggie Shipstead
description: Marian Graves, a female aviator, attempts to circumnavigate the globe pole-to-pole in 1950 and vanishes over Antarctica.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: Aging Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo tells the truth about her glamorous life—including her seven marriages—revealing the love of her life was never any husband.

title: My Brilliant Friend
author: Elena Ferrante
description: In a poor Naples neighborhood in the 1950s, Elena and Lila form an intense friendship that spans decades of rivalry and bonds.

title: The Poisonwood Bible
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: In 1959, an evangelical Baptist family moves to the Belgian Congo. Through four daughters' voices, we witness colonialism and survival.

title: Prodigal Summer
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: Three intertwined stories set in Appalachian Virginia exploring nature's interconnectedness through a wildlife biologist, feuding neighbors, and a young widow.

title: The Reader
author: Bernhard Schlink
description: Fifteen-year-old Michael begins an affair with Hanna, 36. Years later, he discovers her terrible secret when she stands trial for Nazi war crimes.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
author: Milan Kundera
description: In Prague Spring-era Czechoslovakia, surgeon Tomas loves both his wife and his mistress. As the Soviets invade, all three must choose between commitment and freedom.

title: The Memory Keeper's Daughter
author: Kim Edwards
description: In 1964, a doctor secretly gives away his newborn daughter with Down syndrome. The secret corrodes everything over 25 years.

title: This Is How It Always Is
author: Laurie Frankel
description: Claude, the youngest of five boys, wants to be a girl. Her parents support her transition to Poppy, navigating secrets and identity.

title: The Female Persuasion
author: Meg Wolitzer
description: College freshman Greer is inspired by legendary feminist Faith Frank. Over decades, both navigate ambition and what feminism means across generations.

title: The History of Bees
author: Maja Lunde
description: Three timelines spanning 1852 to 2098 explore humanity's relationship with bees through a biologist, a beekeeper, and a woman hand-pollinating crops.

title: The Circle
author: Dave Eggers
description: Mae lands a dream job at The Circle, a powerful tech company. As she rises, she embraces 'transparency' with dystopian consequences.

title: Girl, Woman, Other
author: Bernardine Evaristo
description: Twelve interconnected characters—mostly Black British women—navigate identity, family, love, and politics across decades.

title: Euphoria
author: Lily King
description: Inspired by Margaret Mead, three anthropologists form a charged love triangle while studying tribes in 1930s New Guinea.

title: The Twelve Tribes of Hattie
author: Ayana Mathis
description: Hattie flees Georgia for Philadelphia during the Great Migration. Each chapter follows one of her children navigating race and survival.

title: Tell Me How to Be
author: Neel Patel
description: After her husband's death, Renu returns home with her gay son Akash. Mother and son reveal secrets they've kept from each other.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: Kya, abandoned by her family, raises herself in the North Carolina marshes. When a local man is found dead, she becomes the prime suspect.

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus
description: In the 1960s, brilliant chemist Elizabeth Zott is forced out of her lab and ends up hosting a cooking show that inadvertently sparks a feminist revolution.

title: An American Marriage
author: Tayari Jones
description: Newlyweds Roy and Celestial are torn apart when Roy is wrongfully convicted. When he's exonerated after five years, can their marriage survive?

title: The Storied Life of A.J. Fikry
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: Widowed, bitter bookseller A.J. Fikry finds a mysterious package: an abandoned toddler with a note asking him to raise her.

title: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: Sam and Sadie meet as children and bond over video games. As adults, they create a groundbreaking game together, navigating decades of collaboration.

title: The Measure
author: Nikki Erlick
description: Every adult on Earth receives a box containing a string—the exact measure of their lifespan. Society fractures as people face knowing their fate.

title: Blame
author: Michelle Huneven
description: Patsy, an alcoholic professor, kills two people in a drunk-driving accident. After prison, she rebuilds her life, but true redemption remains out of reach.

title: Losing the Light
author: Andrea Dunlop
description: While studying abroad in France, Brooke becomes obsessed with glamorous Sophie. Years later, Sophie reappears with a request.

title: Come and Get It
author: Kiley Reid
description: A professor researching wealth inequality, an ambitious resident advisor, and a secretive senior form a triangular dynamic on a college campus.

title: Such a Fun Age
author: Kiley Reid
description: When young Black babysitter Emira is accused of kidnapping her white charge, her employer Alix tries to help—for reasons that aren't entirely altruistic.

title: Tell Me Everything
author: Elizabeth Strout
description: In small-town Maine, writer Lucy Barton and retired lawyer Bob Burgess share stories about the people around them.

title: Madwoman
author: Chelsea Bieker
description: Clove flees her abusive husband with her children to hide in a remote coastal town. As her past closes in, she'll do whatever it takes.

title: Theft
author: Abdulrazak Gurnah
description: Two immigrants from Zanzibar navigate life in 1990s England, their stories of displacement and memory unfolding.

title: Lightbreakers
author: Aja Gabel
description: Scientists at a prestigious physics lab race to capture light. The intense female friendships and rivalries prove just as volatile as the science.

title: Jonathan Abernathy You Are Kind
author: Molly McGhee
description: Drowning in debt, Jonathan takes a surreal government job entering strangers' dreams to collect nightmares.

title: Happiness Falls
author: Angie Kim
description: When Eugene vanishes during a walk with his non-speaking autistic son, the family must find out what happened when the only witness can't easily tell them.

title: Vanishing Maps
author: Cristina García
description: Multiple generations of a Cuban family scattered across the world grapple with the revolution's aftermath and what home means.

title: The Leftover Woman
author: Jean Kwok
description: A Chinese birth mother searches for the daughter she was forced to give up, while the adoptive mother suspects the adoption wasn't ethical.

title: Within Arm's Reach
author: Ann Napolitano
description: When Gracie becomes unexpectedly pregnant, the news unearths decades of secrets among her grandmother, mother, and sisters.

title: The Bright Years
author: Sarah Dampf
description: A story of female friendship, marriage, and the secrets women keep from each other over years of close intimacy.

title: To the Moon and Back
author: Eliana Ramage
description: A family navigates love, loss, and resilience as they face life's challenges together.

title: Addison's Wake
author: Sam Calvo
description: After their friend Addison dies, a group gathers and reflects on grief, friendship, and what they left unsaid.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: In 1930s Alabama, young Scout Finch watches her lawyer father defend a Black man falsely accused of rape.

title: The River Is Waiting
author: Wally Lamb
description: Corby, a new father with hidden addiction, causes a tragedy. Sentenced to prison, he searches for redemption and forgiveness.

title: A Separate Peace
author: John Knowles
description: At a New England boarding school during WWII, the intense friendship between introverted Gene and charismatic Phineas changes everything.

title: White Dog Fell from the Sky
author: Eleanor Morse
description: Botswana, 1977. Isaac flees apartheid South Africa. Alice, an American in a failing marriage, hires him. When Isaac is seized, Alice ventures into danger.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
author: Wilson Rawls
description: Billy dreams of owning two coonhounds. Together they become the finest hunting team in the Ozarks. But tragedy awaits.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two sisters in Nazi-occupied France take different paths: one shelters a German soldier, the other joins the Resistance.

title: The Four Winds
author: Kristin Hannah
description: During the 1930s Dust Bowl, Texas farmer Elsa must choose: stay on the dying land or join thousands of migrants heading to California.

title: The Women
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Frances 'Frankie' McGrath, a young nurse, volunteers for Vietnam. Nothing prepares her for the trauma of combat nursing—or the hostility awaiting veterans at home.

title: The Great Alone
author: Kristin Hannah
description: In 1974, a troubled Vietnam vet moves his family to Alaska. The isolation amplifies his violent PTSD, endangering his wife and daughter.

title: True Colors
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Three sisters compete for their distant father's approval and the family's horse ranch. When one is accused of a terrible crime, family bonds are tested.

title: Circling the Sun
author: Paula McLain
description: Based on Beryl Markham, who grew up among Kenyan tribes, trained racehorses, and became the first person to fly solo across the Atlantic east to west.

title: The Paris Wife
author: Paula McLain
description: Hadley Richardson is Ernest Hemingway's first wife. Through her eyes, we experience 1920s Paris—and her heartbreak as Ernest's star rises.

title: Love and Ruin
author: Paula McLain
description: Martha Gellhorn meets Hemingway while covering the Spanish Civil War. She's determined to be one of the greatest war correspondents—not just 'a wife.'

title: When the Stars Go Dark
author: Paula McLain
description: Detective Anna Hart, traumatized by her past, retreats to Mendocino. When a local girl goes missing, Anna must face her own buried secrets.

title: The Address
author: Fiona Davis
description: In 1884, Sara manages the newly built Dakota apartments. In 1985, her great-great-granddaughter uncovers a century-old mystery.

title: The Lions of Fifth Avenue
author: Fiona Davis
description: In 1913, Laura lives inside the New York Public Library and secretly attends journalism school. In 1993, her granddaughter investigates rare book thefts.

title: The Other Einstein
author: Marie Benedict
description: Mileva Marić, one of the only women to study physics in Europe, falls for Albert Einstein. She may have contributed to his theories, then been erased.

title: The Personal Librarian
author: Marie Benedict & Victoria Christopher Murray
description: Belle da Costa Greene becomes J.P. Morgan's personal librarian—while hiding that she's a Black woman passing as white.

title: First Ladies
author: Marie Benedict & Victoria Christopher Murray
description: Eleanor Roosevelt and Mary McLeod Bethune form an unlikely friendship that influences New Deal policies and challenges racial status quo.

title: The Alice Network
author: Kate Quinn
description: In 1947, American Charlie seeks her missing cousin. She enlists Eve, a former WWI spy haunted by betrayal. Together they hunt for answers.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
description: Nitta Sayuri recounts her life from a poor fishing village to becoming one of Kyoto's most celebrated geisha.

title: The Red Tent
author: Anita Diamant
description: Dinah, the only daughter of Jacob, tells her story—giving voice to the women of Genesis who gathered in the red tent.

title: Water for Elephants
author: Sara Gruen
description: During the Depression, young Jacob joins a circus and falls for Marlena—who's married to the violent animal trainer.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: Le Cirque des Rêves appears without warning. Within it, two young magicians create wonders for each other without knowing only one can survive.

title: Homecoming
author: Kate Morton
description: In 1959 Australia, a family is found dead at a picnic—except for the baby. Decades later, journalist Jess uncovers her connection.

title: The Postmistress of Paris
author: Meg Waite Clayton
description: American heiress Nanée risks everything to help artists and intellectuals escape Nazi-occupied France.

title: The Signature of All Things
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: Alma Whittaker, born in 1800, becomes a world-renowned botanist. Through her long life, she grapples with science, faith, and unrequited love.

title: Island Queen
author: Vanessa Riley
description: Based on Dorothy Kirwan Thomas, born into slavery in Montserrat, who bought her freedom and became one of the wealthiest landowners in the Caribbean.

title: The Sweetness of Water
author: Nathan Harris
description: As the Civil War ends in Georgia, two newly freed brothers and a grieving white farmer form an unlikely bond.

title: Orphan Train
author: Christina Baker Kline
description: Molly, a foster teen, helps 91-year-old Vivian clean out her attic—and discovers Vivian was an Irish orphan sent west on the 'orphan trains' in 1929.

title: Under the Wide and Starry Sky
author: Nancy Horan
description: Fanny Van de Grift Osbourne, an American divorcée, meets struggling writer Robert Louis Stevenson. Their unconventional marriage takes them around the world.

title: Loving Frank
author: Nancy Horan
description: Mamah Borthwick Cheney leaves her husband and children to be with architect Frank Lloyd Wright. Their story ends in unimaginable tragedy.

title: Z: A Novel of Zelda Fitzgerald
author: Therese Anne Fowler
description: Zelda Sayre marries promising writer Scott Fitzgerald. As his star rises with The Great Gatsby, hers dims—until madness and heartbreak consume them.

title: The Zookeeper's Wife
author: Diane Ackerman
description: The Żabińskis ran the Warsaw Zoo when Germany invaded. Using empty animal cages, they helped smuggle hundreds of Jews to safety.

title: The Painted Girls
author: Cathy Marie Buchanan
description: The Van Goethem sisters struggle in 1880s Paris. Marie poses for Degas's Little Dancer sculpture while her sister performs at Montmartre cabarets.

title: Snow Flower and the Secret Fan
author: Lisa See
description: In 19th-century China, Lily and Snow Flower are matched as laotong—bound for life. They communicate through nu shu, women's secret writing.

title: To Capture What We Cannot Keep
author: Beatrice Colin
description: In 1886 Paris, Scottish widow Caitriona and Émile Nouguier—one of the Eiffel Tower's designers—fall in love.

title: Moloka'i
author: Alan Brennert
description: Seven-year-old Rachel is torn from her Hawaiian family when she contracts leprosy and is exiled to Moloka'i.

title: The Danish Girl
author: David Ebershoff
description: In 1920s Copenhagen, Einar Wegener poses in women's clothes for his wife's portrait—and discovers she is actually Lili Elbe.

title: The Many Daughters of Afong Moy
author: Jamie Ford
description: Dorothy undergoes epigenetic treatment that unlocks memories of seven generations of Chinese-American women.

title: River Sing Me Home
author: Eleanor Shearer
description: When slavery ends in the British Caribbean in 1834, Rachel sets out searching for the five children who were sold away from her.

title: Lilac Girls
author: Martha Hall Kelly
description: Three women's lives converge around Ravensbrück: an American socialite, a Polish prisoner subjected to experiments, and the German doctor who performed them.

title: Run Rose Run
author: Dolly Parton & James Patterson
description: AnnieLee Keyes arrives in Nashville with a guitar, a dream, and a dark secret. As she rises, her violent past catches up.

title: Know My Name
author: Chanel Miller
description: The woman known as 'Emily Doe' in the Stanford case reclaims her identity and tells her full story.

title: Just Mercy
author: Bryan Stevenson
description: Civil rights lawyer Bryan Stevenson fought to free Walter McMillian, wrongfully sentenced to death. A searing indictment of American justice.

title: Born a Crime
author: Trevor Noah
description: Trevor Noah was born to a Black mother and white father in apartheid South Africa—where such a union was literally a crime.

title: The Glass Castle
author: Jeannette Walls
description: Walls grew up with brilliant, neglectful parents who moved constantly. Her father was a charismatic alcoholic; her mother, an artist who resented motherhood.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: Raised by survivalist Mormon parents, Tara never attended school. At 17, she began self-educating—eventually earning a Cambridge PhD.

title: The Year of Magical Thinking
author: Joan Didion
description: Days after her husband dies of a heart attack, their daughter falls into a coma. Didion chronicles a year of grief with precision.

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: After a devastating divorce, Gilbert spends a year traveling: eating in Italy, praying in India, and finding balance in Bali.

title: The Sun Does Shine
author: Anthony Ray Hinton
description: Hinton spent 30 years on Alabama's death row for murders he didn't commit. Bryan Stevenson finally won his freedom.

title: Broken Horses
author: Brandi Carlile
description: The Grammy-winning singer recounts growing up poor, being rejected for baptism as gay, finding her musical voice, and building a family.

title: The Light We Carry
author: Michelle Obama
description: The former First Lady shares practical wisdom for navigating uncertain times—tools she's used to deal with change and visibility.

title: A Million Little Pieces
author: James Frey
description: Frey's account of rehab for alcohol and crack addiction—controversial after revelations of significant fabrications.

title: Lit
author: Mary Karr
description: The third volume of Karr's memoir trilogy follows her from blackout drinking through psychiatric wards to sobriety and Catholicism.

title: The Liar's Club
author: Mary Karr
description: Karr's Texas childhood defined by her oil-worker father's tall tales, her mother's psychotic break, and sexual violence she suffered.

title: Shantaram
author: Gregory David Roberts
description: An Australian heroin addict escapes prison and flees to Bombay, where he lives in a slum, works for the mafia, and finds love.

title: The Master Plan
author: Chris Wilson
description: Sentenced to life at 17 for murder, Wilson created a 'Master Plan' for his future—earning degrees and becoming an advocate for criminal justice reform.

title: Imperfect Endings
author: Zoe Fitzgerald Carter
description: Carter's mother, suffering from Parkinson's, decides to end her life and asks her three daughters to be there.

title: The Monk of Mokha
author: Dave Eggers
description: Mokhtar Alkhanshali becomes obsessed with reviving Yemen's ancient coffee tradition—then gets trapped as civil war erupts.

title: Dying to Be Me
author: Anita Moorjani
description: After a four-year battle with cancer, Moorjani experienced what she describes as a near-death experience. She recovered completely.

title: The Line Becomes a River
author: Francisco Cantú
description: Cantú joined the Border Patrol to understand immigration. Four years of discovering bodies left him questioning everything.

title: The Oregon Trail
author: Rinker Buck
description: In 2011, Buck and his brother traveled 2,000 miles in a covered wagon, retracing the pioneer route.

title: Lots of Candles, Plenty of Cake
author: Anna Quindlen
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning columnist reflects on turning 60—examining marriage, motherhood, friendship, faith, and work.

title: Happy-Go-Lucky
author: David Sedaris
description: Sedaris's essay collection confronts his father's decline and death, the pandemic, and family complexities—with dark humor.

title: Lucky
author: Alice Sebold
description: Sebold's memoir of being raped as a college freshman. CONTROVERSY: The convicted man was exonerated in 2021.

title: Magical Thinking
author: Augusten Burroughs
description: Darkly comic essays about Burroughs's neurotic life: relationships, addictions, and the death of his partner from AIDS.

title: A Girl Named Zippy
author: Haven Kimmel
description: Kimmel's funny, tender memoir of growing up in tiny Mooreland, Indiana in the 1960s-70s.

title: With or Without You
author: Domenica Ruta
description: Ruta grew up with a charismatic, drug-addicted mother who loved her fiercely but couldn't protect her.

title: I Am Because You Are
author: Jacob Lief
description: Lief founded the Ubuntu Education Fund in South Africa's townships, transforming lives during the AIDS crisis.

title: Heartland
author: Sarah Smarsh
description: Smarsh grew up among the working poor of rural Kansas—a world invisible to coastal America.

title: Careless People
author: Sarah Wynn Williams
description: A former Meta executive's insider account of Facebook during its most turbulent years.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: Struggling writer Lowen discovers an autobiographical manuscript revealing horrifying secrets about injured bestselling author Verity Crawford's family.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: On their fifth anniversary, Nick's wife Amy disappears. As suspicion falls on Nick, the narrative reveals a marriage far darker than imagined.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Journalist Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander investigate a 40-year-old disappearance—uncovering family violence and murder.

title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Lisbeth becomes the prime suspect in three murders. She goes underground while Blomkvist tries to clear her name.

title: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Lisbeth lies in intensive care while a secret faction within Swedish intelligence prepares to silence her forever.

title: The Girl Who Lived Twice
author: David Lagercrantz
description: Lisbeth investigates a death on Mount Everest that connects to Russian intelligence and her own past.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: Rachel takes the same train every day, watching a couple—until she sees something shocking and becomes entangled in a missing persons case.

title: The Maid
author: Nita Prose
description: Molly, a hotel maid who loves her orderly routines, discovers a wealthy guest dead. Her difficulty reading social cues makes her the prime suspect.

title: Sadie
author: Courtney Summers
description: When Sadie's little sister is murdered, she sets off to find the killer herself, told alongside a true-crime podcast investigating her disappearance.

title: The Child
author: Fiona Barton
description: When a baby's skeleton is discovered, journalist Kate Waters investigates. Multiple women harbor secrets about babies lost decades ago.

title: The Night Bird
author: Brian Freeman
description: Psychiatrist Francesca Stein uses 'memory surgery' to help patients forget traumas. When her patients start dying, detective Frost Easton investigates.

title: Lightning Strike
author: William Kent Krueger
description: In 1963 Minnesota, 12-year-old Cork O'Connor witnesses a suspicious death on the Iron Lake reservation.

title: The House Across the Lake
author: Riley Sager
description: Actress Casey, hiding at her Vermont lake house, becomes obsessed with the glamorous couple across the water—until the wife disappears.

title: Pretty Things
author: Janelle Brown
description: Nina is a grifter who targets the wealthy through Instagram. Her next mark is Vanessa, a struggling influencer with secrets of her own.

title: Bunny
author: Mona Awad
description: Samantha, an outsider at her elite MFA program, is invited into the 'Bunny' clique and discovers their creative process is disturbingly literal.

title: Truly Madly Guilty
author: Liane Moriarty
description: Three couples attend a neighborhood barbecue. Something terrible happens—but the novel withholds what until we understand how fragile all six lives were.

title: When I'm Gone
author: Emily Bleeker
description: After his wife dies of cancer, Luke discovers she left letters revealing secrets about their marriage and children.

title: I Am the Messenger
author: Markus Zusak
description: Ed Kennedy, an underage cab driver, accidentally stops a bank robbery and starts receiving playing cards with addresses—tasks that will transform lives.

title: Daring Greatly
author: Brené Brown
description: Brown's research reveals that vulnerability is the birthplace of courage, creativity, and connection. Strategies for embracing imperfection.

title: Dare to Lead
author: Brené Brown
description: Brown applies vulnerability research to leadership—daring leaders must embrace uncertainty and practice empathy.

title: Braving the Wilderness
author: Brené Brown
description: True belonging requires the courage to stand alone. How we can belong to ourselves while still connecting with others.

title: Stages of Meditation
author: The Dalai Lama
description: Commentary on Kamalashila's 9th-century text, offering teachings on developing calm abiding and the wisdom of emptiness.

title: An Open Heart
author: The Dalai Lama
description: Practical methods for cultivating compassion and wisdom in daily life—accessible to practitioners of any faith.

title: The Art of Happiness
author: The Dalai Lama & Howard Cutler
description: Psychiatrist Cutler interviews the Dalai Lama about achieving happiness, weaving Eastern wisdom with Western psychology.

title: The Middle Way
author: The Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama's commentary on Nagarjuna's philosophy, exploring emptiness and the middle path between extremes.

title: Mind in Comfort and Ease
author: The Dalai Lama
description: Teachings on finding peace through understanding the nature of consciousness and developing meditation practice.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd, dreams of treasure at the pyramids. His journey becomes a quest for something far greater.

title: Anger
author: Thich Nhat Hanh
description: The Vietnamese Zen master teaches that anger must be embraced mindfully—like a crying baby—rather than suppressed.

title: How to Meet Your Self
author: Dr. Nicole LePera
description: A workbook guiding readers through exercises to uncover conditioned patterns and discover their authentic selves.

title: How to Be the Love You Seek
author: Dr. Nicole LePera
description: Explores how childhood attachment wounds shape adult relationships and offers tools for healing trauma bonds.

title: Infinite Possibilities
author: Mike Dooley
description: The philosophy that thoughts become things, and we can consciously create our reality through belief and visualization.

title: Notes from the Universe
author: Mike Dooley
description: Brief, encouraging messages 'from the Universe' designed to shift perspective toward hope and possibility.

title: How to Win Friends & Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
description: Carnegie's timeless guide: show genuine interest in others, remember names, listen well, make others feel important.

title: The Buddha Walks into the Office
author: Lodro Rinzler
description: Applies Buddhist principles to workplace challenges: dealing with difficult coworkers, finding meaning, and leading with compassion.

title: Ramakrishna and His Disciples
author: Christopher Isherwood
description: Isherwood's biography of the 19th-century Hindu mystic who experienced divine ecstasy in multiple religious traditions.

title: Mindfulness in Plain English
author: Bhante Gunaratana
description: A clear, practical guide to Vipassana meditation covering breath awareness, dealing with distractions, and developing insight.

title: Taking the Leap
author: Pema Chödrön
description: Explores 'shenpa'—the hook of habitual reactions—and how mindfulness can free us from automatic patterns.

title: No Self, No Problem
author: Anam Thubten
description: Makes the challenging Buddhist concept of 'no-self' accessible, showing how letting go of ego leads to liberation.

title: Perfectly Imperfect
author: Baron Baptiste
description: Baptiste's yoga philosophy: transformation through accepting imperfection and committing to authentic practice.

title: Mentors
author: Russell Brand
description: Brand shares wisdom from his mentors—from his judo teacher to spiritual guides—on recovery and spiritual growth.

title: The Art of Worldly Wisdom
author: Baltasar Gracián
description: Three hundred aphorisms on navigating life from a 17th-century Spanish Jesuit.

title: How to Talk So Kids Will Listen
author: Adele Faber & Elaine Mazlish
description: Practical communication techniques for parents: acknowledging children's feelings, engaging cooperation, alternatives to punishment.

title: The Self-Driven Child
author: William Stixrud & Ned Johnson
description: Giving children more control over their lives—rather than micromanaging—reduces anxiety and builds motivation.

title: Leadership (HBR's 10 Must Reads)
author: Harvard Business Review
description: Essential HBR articles on leadership, including emotional intelligence and Level 5 leadership.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: Alex and Poppy are best friends who take an annual vacation together—until something went wrong. One more trip to fix what broke.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
description: Romance writer January and literary fiction writer Gus make a bet: she'll write literary fiction, he'll write romance.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: Quirky Louisa becomes the caretaker for wealthy, paralyzed Will, who plans to end his life. CONTROVERSIAL ending.

title: A Man Called Ove
author: Fredrik Backman
description: Ove is a grumpy 59-year-old widower ready to end his life—but his new neighbors keep interrupting his suicide attempts.

title: My Grandmother Asked Me to Tell You She's Sorry
author: Fredrik Backman
description: Seven-year-old Elsa's grandmother dies, leaving behind letters to deliver—and fairy tales that turn out to be more real than imagined.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
author: V.E. Schwab
description: In 1714, Addie makes a deal: immortality, but no one will ever remember her. For 300 years she's forgotten—until a boy remembers her name.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
description: Henry has a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably. Clare has known him since she was six. Their love defies time.

title: The Bookshop of Second Chances
author: Jackie Fraser
description: After her marriage ends, Thea inherits a house in a Scottish village. She finds rare books—and a grumpy bookseller across the street.

title: The Little Paris Bookshop
author: Nina George
description: Jean Perdu runs a floating bookshop, prescribing novels for what ails customers—but hasn't opened a letter from his lost love in 21 years.

title: The Little French Bistro
author: Nina George
description: Marianne attempts suicide on her anniversary trip to Paris. She survives and flees to Brittany, where a coastal village revives her.

title: The Flamenco Academy
author: Sarah Bird
description: Cyndi Rae becomes obsessed with flamenco dancing—and with Tomás. She discovers flamenco's demand for duende: soul-deep passion.

title: The Hurricane Sisters
author: Dorothea Benton Frank
description: Three generations of Lowcountry women navigate family secrets as an actual hurricane approaches the South Carolina coast.

title: Gemini
author: Carol Cassella
description: A Jane Doe lies in a Seattle ICU. Her doctor becomes obsessed with discovering who she is—while across town, a woman's life unravels.

title: The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared
author: Jonas Jonasson
description: Allan Karlsson climbs out of his nursing home on his 100th birthday and embarks on a madcap adventure.

title: It Starts with Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: The sequel to It Ends with Us: Lily reconnects with her first love Atlas while navigating co-parenting with her abusive ex.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
description: When huntress Feyre kills a faerie wolf, she's dragged into the immortal realm. Beauty and the Beast retelling.

title: The Devil in the White City
author: Erik Larson
description: Two parallel stories of the 1893 Chicago World's Fair: architect Burnham building the White City, and serial killer H.H. Holmes constructing his Murder Castle.

title: Dead Wake
author: Erik Larson
description: The final crossing of the Lusitania in 1915: the passengers, the U-boat captain, and the decisions that led to 1,198 deaths.

title: The Swerve
author: Stephen Greenblatt
description: In 1417, a book hunter discovered a lost poem by Lucretius. Greenblatt argues this rediscovery helped spark the Renaissance.

title: The Boys in the Boat
author: Daniel James Brown
description: Nine working-class American boys shocked the world by defeating Hitler's team to win gold in rowing at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

title: Little Movements
author: Lauren Morrow
description: Layla Smart, a Black artist at a Vermont dance residency, navigates tokenism, a fracturing marriage, and the studio's problematic past.

title: Silence on the Mountain
author: Daniel Wilkinson
description: Wilkinson investigates Guatemala's civil war through a single coffee plantation, uncovering how power and violence shaped the country.

title: Bitter Fruit
author: Stephen Schlesinger & Stephen Kinzer
description: The definitive account of the CIA-orchestrated 1954 coup that overthrew Guatemala's democratically elected president.

title: Wards of the State
author: Claudia Rowe
description: Through six former foster youth, journalist Rowe traces the foster care-to-prison pipeline.

title: Empire of AI
author: Karen Hao
description: Investigation into OpenAI and the AI arms race, exposing the exploited global workforce building these systems.
